meta_title: Metalhead isn't black and white : blackmirror
text_raw:
Press to jump to the feed.
Bear with me.
Working with computer vision for while now, one of the first steps to making sense of any image is converting from RGB to grayscale.
This is something done for self driving cars, facial recognition and very likely killer dogs too.
As such, anytime we see something shot in "black and white" during the episode, it's not for the aesthetic, but because that's exactly what the dogs would see.

level ★★★★★ 4.555 62 points years ago edited years ago computer sees two-tone picture as matrix array of numbers, where position in the matrix corresponds to pixel of the picture, and the value on that position to the colour of that pixel.
In black and white picture, single pixel is either black value or white value In the other hand, in gray-scale picture pixel may have one of 256 Values: is still black and still white, but eg. pixel value of 0.5 is gray shade halfway between half and white.
So gray scale picture has 254 more different colours than its black and white correspodent there's big difference detail-wise.
Not sure on that 256 but it's some power of because computers Edit: don't know if this is true but I'll risk to say that the power of you choose is the detail you want in the picture higher power/more detail/larger file So black and white picture is gray scale one with power of 1.
Not sure of this but it makes sense guess.
